instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.SMC_LID_RIGHT: What is SMC_LID_RIGHT? SMC_LID_RIGHT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the right LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed â€“ if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_RIGHT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Display wont turning on once closed the LID
threads.message:
Not a Business, Just learning from experts, 

I'm trying to fix one of <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>-2016 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) which is recently replaced the OEM battery and after the battery change,  now its display not turning on once the lid is closed/open. and there is no other issues (Like charging issues). The battery seems working fine.  Once the lid is closed and open, the Machine is waking up and every other functions are working fine except the display. and it is not turn off when keeps holding the power button and only respond to SMC reset buttons when the lid is closed and open. 

Any suggestions, please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Display wont turning on once closed the LID
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Check the three lid signals, once Mac comes back from sleep (<CHIP>U5255</CHIP>).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Display wont turning on once closed the LID
threads.message:
All signals LID signals are checked and OK. <CHIP>U5255</CHIP> / Hall sensors (R/L) also working perfectly. and display also check with other board and working fine.

Thank you,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Display wont turning on once closed the LID
threads.message:
So you get 3V at pins 1, 2 & 4 of <CHIP>U5255</CHIP> after close/open lid for sure?

Can you turn it off with power button, before close the lid?
Check if power button works correctly without battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Display wont turning on once closed the LID
threads.message:
Sorry for the late reply! Just checked again and figures are as follows,

PIN 1 - 0V. (<RESISTOR>R5253</RESISTOR> Checked) :) 
PIN 2 - 3.4V (<RESISTOR>R5252</RESISTOR> Checked)
PIN 4 - 3.3V  (<RESISTOR>R5255</RESISTOR> Checked)

And the power button/touch ID  is working perfectly. Any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Display wont turning on once closed the LID
threads.message:
"PIN 1 - 0V. (<RESISTOR>R5253</RESISTOR> Checked)"
Righ hall sensor issue.
Check <CAPACITOR>C5260</CAPACITOR> first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Display wont turning on once closed the LID
threads.message:
Just resoldered the Righ hall sensor and still, the same values are showing.

<CAPACITOR>C5260</CAPACITOR> - NOSTUFF &  PIN 1 - 0V But I'm getting 3.3v on the top of the right hall sensor. 

Thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Display wont turning on once closed the LID
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Display wont turning on once closed the LID
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Display wont turning on once closed the LID
threads.message:
Seems that pull-up resistor is near the hall sensor, not on MLB.
Check it there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Display wont turning on once closed the LID
threads.message: Did you mean that resistor on the R hall sensor? Sorry, don't get it clearly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Display wont turning on once closed the LID
threads.message: Yes, there should be a pull-up resistor for the signal.
